desc: TO RATIFY THE TREATY (7 STAT 81, FEB. 14, 1805) BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE DELAWARE INDIANS, FOR THE EXTINGUISHMENT OF THEIR TITLE TO A TRACT OF COUNTRY BETWEEN THE OHIO AND WABASH RIVERS, CONCLUDED AT VINCENNES ON AUG. 18, 1804.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY (7 STAT 83, FEB. 6, 1805) BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE PIANKESHAW INDIANS, CONCLUDED AT VINCENNES ON AUG. 27, 1804.

TO AMEND THE MOTION MADE BY STEPHEN R. BRADLEY (D-VT) BY ELIMINATING AFTER THE WORD "ORDERED" THE FOLLOWING WORDS "THAT SAMUEL CHASE FILE HIS ANSWER WITH THE SEC. OF THE SENATE, TO THE SEVERAL ARTICLES OF IMPEACHMENT EXHIBITED AGAINST HIM BY THE HOUSE OF REPS; A MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE IMPEACHMENT OF SAMUEL CHASE, ONE OF THE ASSOCIATE JUSTICES OF THE SUPREME COURT.
TO AMEND THE ORDER OF THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF SAMUEL CHASE BY SETTING A DATE (AT THE DISCRETION OF THE SENATE) FOR RECEIVING THE ANSWER AND PROCEEDING TO THE TRIAL.  (P. 99)
TO AMEND THE ORDER RELATING TO IMPEACHMENT PROCEEDINGS AGAINST SAMUEL CHASE, BY FIXING THE FIRST MONDAY OF DEC. NEXT AS THE DAY FOR RECEIVING HIS ANSWER AND PROCEEDING TO THE TRIAL.  (P. 99)
TO AMEND THE ORDER RELATING TO IMPEACHMENT PROCEEDINGS AGAINST SAMUEL CHASE, BY FIXING FEB. 4TH NEXT AS THE DAY FOR RECEIVING HIS ANSWER.  (P. 100)
TO AGREE TO THE ORDER, AS AMENDED, SETTING THE 4TH DAY OF FEB. NEXT AS THE DAY OF RECEIVING SAMUEL CHASE'S ANSWER AND COMMENCING HIS TRIAL OF IMPEACHMENT.  (P. 100)

TO AMEND H.R. 5, (2 STAT 342, MAR. 3, 1805), A BILL FOR CLEARANCE OF ARMED MERCHANT VESSELS, BY PROVIDING THAT BEFORE CLEARANCE PAPERS ARE GIVEN, BOND GIVEN BY VESSEL OWNERS, BE INCREASED $10,000.  TO BE FORFEITED IF ARMS ARE USED EXCEPT IN SELF-DEFENCE.  (P. 34)
TO RATIFY THE TREATY (7 STAT 84, FEB. 21, 1805) BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE SAC AND FOX INDIANS, MADE AT ST. LOUIS ON NOV. 3, 1804.
TO PASS H.R. 19, (6 STAT 56, JAN. 23, 1805), A BILL RELATING TO THE CLAIM OF CHARLOTTE HAZEN, WIDOW OF BRIGADIER GENERAL MOSES HAZEN.  (P. 37)
TO AMEND THE BILL, CONCERNING PUBLIC ROADS, BY STRIKING THE WORDS "ONE TWENTIETH PART" IN FIRST SECTION.  (P. 37)
TO AMEND THE BILL, CONCERNING PUBLIC ROADS; BY INSERTING IN THE FIRST SECTION THE WORDS, "REMAINING TWO PERCENT." (P. 37)
TO RECEIVE PETITION OF QUAKERS IN PENNSYLVANIA, AND NEW JERSEY, TO PLEAD CAUSE OF THE SLAVES.  (P. 39)

TO ORDER THIRD READING, OF S. 6, (2 STAT 345, MAR. 3, 1805), A BILL IN ADDITION TO AN ACT TO MAKE PROVISION FOR PERSONS THAT HAVE BEEN DISABLED BY KNOWN WOUNDS RECEIVED IN THE ACTUAL SERVICE OF THE U.S. DURING THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR. (P. 43)

TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION, REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO LAY BEFORE THE SENATE, DOCUMENTS AND PAPERS RELATIVE TO COMPLAINTS AGAINST ARRIVING MERCHANT SHIPS, AND THE CONDUCT OF CAPTAINS AND CREWS OF SUCH SHIPS AS HAVE BEEN ARRIVED. (P. 44)
TO REFER TO SELECT COMMITTEE, THE PETITION OF ANDREW JACKSON TO AMEND ARTICLES AND RULES OF THE ARMY IN RESPECT TO DRESS AND UNIFORMS.  (P. 47)

TO ADOPT A SUBSTITUTE RESOLUTION RELATIVE TO RATIFICATION OF INDIANS, AT THE AGENCY NEAR FLINT RIVER ON NOV. 3, 1904; TREATY MADE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CREEK NATION OF WHICH SUBSTITUTTE PROPOSES THAT FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THIS TREATY BE POSTPONED UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER NEXT, AND THAT THE PRESIDENT ENTER INTO FURTHER NEGOTIATIONS WITH THE CREEK INDIANS IN ORDER TO EFFECT, IF POSSIBLE, SUCH MODIFICATION OF THE TERMS, PRICE AND MODE OF PAYMENT AS MAY BE MORE CONFORMABLE TO THE POLICY AND INTEREST OF THE U.S.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CREEK NATION OF INDIANS, CONCLUDED ON NOV. 3, 1804.
TO STRIKE OUT ALL OF H.R. 5, (2 STAT 342, MAR. 3, 1805), A BILL REGULATING THE CLEARANCE OF ARMED MERCHANT VESSELS, AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE.  (P. 49)
TO AMEND H.R. 5, BY PROVIDING THAT THE VESSEL'S OWNER POST A BOND OF $7000 INSTEAD OF THE DOUBLE VALUE OF THE VESSEL AS A SECURITY THAT ARMS WILL NOT BE USED EXCEPT IN SELF-DEFENSE.  (P. 49)
TO AMEND H.R. 5, BY MAKING THE ACT EFFECTIVE WHEN APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT, AND NOT AFTER DUE NOTICE HAS BEEN GIVEN TO THE VARIOUS CUSTOM HOUSES.  (P. 50)
TO PASS H.R. 33, (2 STAT 315, FEB. 14, 1805), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE POSTMASTER GENERAL TO MAKE A NEW CONTRACT FOR CARRYING MAIL FROM FAYETTEVILLE, N. CAROLINA, TO CHARLESTON, S. CAROLINA.  (P. 51)
TO INSTRUCT THE SEC. OF THE SENATE TO INFORM THE HOUSE THAT THE SENATE WILL TOMORROW, AT 12 O'CLOCK, PROCEED TO THE TRIAL OF THE IMPEACHMENT OF SAMUEL CHASE.
TO DECIDE THE COMPETENCE OF THE MANAGERS OF THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF SAMUEL CHASE, TO ASK THE WITNESS A CERTAIN QUESTION.
TO DECIDE WHETHER, IN THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF SAMUEL CHASE THE WITNESS BE PERMITTED TO MAKE USE OF PAPER CONTAINING A STATEMENT OF FACTS PREPARED BY HIMSELF AND OTHER GENTLEMEN.

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT IN AN IMPEACHMENT TRIAL, UPON A QUESTION BEING REFERRED TO THE DECISION OF THE SENATE, IN CASE IT BE REQUIRED BY A MAJORITY OF THE MEMBERS PRESENT, THE SENATE SHALL RETURN TO THEIR CHAMBERS, WHEREUPON THE QUESTION TO BE DECIDED SHALL BE STATED BY THE PRESIDENT, AND EACH MEMBER SHALL BE AT LIBERTY TO STATE THE REASONS FOR HIS OPINION BUT SHALL NOT BE ALLOWED TO SPEAK MORE THAN ONCE.  AFTER THE MEMBERS HAVE DELIVERED THEIR OPINIONS, THE SENATE SHALL RETURN TO THEIR JUDICIAL CHAMBER, WHERE THE QUESTION SHALL BE DETERMINED BY YEAS AND NAYS.
TO DECIDE THE COMPETENCY OF COUNSEL IN THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL FOR JUDGE SAMUEL CHASE TO ASK A CERTAIN QUESTION.
TO DECIDE IF THE COURT SHALL EXAMINE EVIDENCE, FOR THE PURPOSE OF REBUTTING TESTIMONY WHICH SHOWED THAT JUDGE CHASE HAD A CORRUPT INTENTION TO PACK A JURY, IN THE TRIAL OF CALLENDAR.
TO STRIKE OUT ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE OF S. 8, (2 STAT 322, MAR. 2, 1805), A BILL FURTHER PROVIDING FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF THE TERRITORY OF ORLEANS.  (P. 60)
TO AMEND H.R. 5, BY PUNISHING ALL UNLAWFUL ACTS COMMITTED BY ARMED VESSELS ON HIGH SEAS THE SAME AS IF COMMITTED WITHIN THE EXCLUSIVE JURISDICTION OF THE U.S.  (P. 62)
TO PASS H.R. 5.  (P. 63)
TO DECIDE TO SWEAR HUGH HOLMES AS A WITNESS.
TO PROVIDE THAT THE SENATE WILL ON FRIDAY NEXT AT 12 O'CLOCK, PROCEED ON THE TRIAL OF THE ARTICLES OF IMPEACHMENT EXHIBITED BY THE HOUSE AGAINST SAMUEL CHASE.
TO DECIDE WHETHER SAMUEL CHASE IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY A HIGH CRIME OR MISDEMEANOR AS CHARGED IN THE FIRST ARTICLE OF THE IMPEACHMENT.
TO DECIDE WHETHER SAMUEL CHASE IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY OF A HIGH CRIME OR MISDEMEANOR AS CHARGED IN THE 2ND ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT.
TO DECIDE WHETHER SAMUEL CHASE IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY OF A HIGH CRIME OR MISDEMEANOR, AS CHARGED IN THE 3RD ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT.
TO DECIDE WHETHER SAMUEL CHASE IS GUILTY OR NOR GUILTY OF A HIGH CRIME OR MISDEMEANOR, AS CHARGED IN THE 4TH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT.
TO DECIDE WHETHER SMAUEL CHASE IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY OF A HIGH CRIME OR MISDEMEANOR, AS CHARGED IN THE 5TH ARTICLE OF THE IMPEACHMENT.
TO DECIDE WHETHER SAMUEL CHASE IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY OF A HIGH CRIME OR MISDEMEANOR, AS CHARGED IN THE 6TH ARTICLE OF THE IMPEACHMENT.
TO DECIDE WHETHER SAMUEL CHASE IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY OF A HIGH CRIME OR MISDEMEANOR, AS CHARGED IN THE 7TH ARTICLE OF THE IMPEACHMENT.
TO DECIDE WHETHER SAMUEL CHASE, IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY OF A HIGH CRIME OR MISDEMEANOR, AS CHARGED IN THE 8TH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 10, A BILL FREEING FROM POSTAGE ALL LETTERS AND PACKAGES TO AND FROM AARON BURR. (P. 66)
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER NEXT, CONSIDERATION OF S. 10.  (P. 68)
TO PASS S. 10.  (P. 68)

TO AMEND H.R. 4, (2 STAT 339, MAR. 3, 1805), A BILL PROVIDING MORE EFFECTUAL PRESERVATION OF PEACE IN U.S. PORTS, BY STRIKING OUT THE FIRST SECTION, THAT ARMED FORCES BE USED IF NECESSARY, FOR THE APPREHENSION OF ANY PERSON ON BOARD A FOREIGN ARMED VESSEL.  (P. 74)
TO PASS H.R. 4 (2 STAT 339, MAR. 3, 1805), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE MORE EFFECTUAL PRESERVATION OF PEACE IN PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE U.S. AND WATERS UNDER THEIR JURISDICTION.  (P. 74)
TO ORDER THE MAIN QUESTION, ON THE RESOLUTION TO INTRODUCE A BILL TO PROHIBIT THE IMPORTATION OF SLAVES INTO ANY PORT OR PLACE WITHIN THE JURISDICTION OF THE U.S., FROM AND AFTER JANUARY 1, 1808.
TO CONSIDER THE BILL TO PROHIBIT THE IMPORTATION OF SLAVES AFTER JAN. 1, 1808, INTO ANY PORT OF THE U.S. TERRITORY.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY (7 STAT L. 89, APP. MAY 22, 1807) BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHICKASAW INDIAN NATION.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY (APP. APRIL 24, 1806, 7 STAT L. 93) BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHEROKEE NATION OF INDIANS.
TO RATIFY THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CREEK NA- TION OF INDIANS.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY (APP. JUNE 10, 1806, 7 STAT L. 95) BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHEROKEE TRIBE OF INDIANS.

TO RATIFY THE TREATY (APP. APRIL 24, 1806, 7 STAT L. 91) MADE AND CONCLUDED AT GROUSELAND IN THE INDIANA TERRITORY ON AUG. 21, 1805, BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE DELAWARE, POTTAWATAMIE, MIAMI, EEL-RIVESRE ND WEEAS TRIBES OF INDIANS.
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE HOUSE BILL ENTITLED: "AN ACT FOR THE RELIEF OF THEODORICK ARMSTEAD."
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE HOUSE BILL ENTITLED, "AN ACT FOR THE RELIEF OF EDWARD TAPPAN, GEORGE JENKINS, AND WILLIAM CURRIER."

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO REFER TO A SPECIAL COMMITTEE THAT PART OF THE PRESIDENTS MESSAGE WHICH RELATES TO THE SPOLIATIONS OF OUR COMMERCE ON THE HIGH SEAS, AND TO THE NEW PRINCIPLE ASSUMED BY THE BRITISH COURTS OF ADMIRALTY, AS A PRETEXT FOR THE CONDEMNATION OF OUR VESSELS IN THEIR PRIZE COURTS.
TO ORDER THE MAIN QUESTION ON  A MOTION TO INTRODUCE A BILL (2 STAT 351, FEB. 28, 1866) TO SUSPEND THE COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE FRENCH ISLAND OF ST. DOMINGO.

TO RATIFY THE TREATY (APP. APR. 24, 1806, 7 STAT L. 87) MADE AND CONCLUDED AT FORT INDUSTRY, ON JULY 4, 1805, BETWEEN THE U.S. AND AGENTS OF THE CONNECTICUT LAND CO. AND THE WYANDOT, OTTAWA, CHIPPEWA, MUNSEE, DELAWARE, SHAWNEE, AND POTTAWATAMIE INDIANS.

TO RATIFY THE TREATY (APP. APR. 24, 1806, 7 STAT L. 87) MADE AND CONCLUDED AT FORT INDUSTRY ON THE MIAMI OF THE LAKE, JULY 4, 1805, BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE WYANDOT, OTTAWA, CHIPPEWA, MUNSEE, DELAWARE, SHAWNEE AND POTAWATAMIE TRIBES OF INDIANS.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION AS AMENDED, THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED TO MAKE A FURTHER COMMUNICATION TO THE SENATE OF JAMES MONROE'S LETTER TO THE SEC. OF STATE, DATED OCT. 18, 1805 WITH A POSTSCRIPT DATED, OCT. 25, 1805.
TO CONFIRM THE APPOINTMENT OF JAMES WILKINSON, AS GOVERNOR OF THE TERRITORY OF LOUISIANA.
TO CONFIRM THE APPOINTMENT OF J.B.C. LUCAS, OF PENNSYLVANIA, AS ONE OF THE JUDGES OF THE TERRITORY OF LOUISIANA.

TO AMEND THE ACT (APP. FEB. 13, 1806, 2 STAT L. 349) MAKING PROVISION FOR DEFRAYING EXTRAORDINARY EXPENSES ATTENDING THE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND FOREIGN NATIONS, BY PROVIDING AN APPROPRIATION FOR THE PURPOSE OF ATTAINING FROM GREAT BRITAIN, THE FREE NAVIGATION OF THE RIVER ST. LAWRENCE.
TO AMEND THE BILL BY ADDING "TOWARD THE SETTLING, ESTABLISH- ING, AND DEFENSE OF THE BOUNDARIES OF THE U.S."- AS ONE OF PURPOSES SERVED BY THIS BILL.

TO AGREE TO AMENDMENT TO HOUSE BILL (APP. 2/28/1806, 2 STAT L. 351) PROVIDING FOR A SUSPENSION OF COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE FRENCH ISLAND OF ST. DOMINGO; SAID AMENDMENT PROHIBITS COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN RESIDENTS OF THE U.S. AND RESIDENTS IN PARTS OF ST. DOMINGO, NOT IN POSSESSION AND UNDER ACKNOWLEDGED GOVERNMENT OF FRANCE, PROVIDING A FORFEITURE OF CARGOS AND SHIPS ENGAGED IN SUCH ILLEGAL TRADE.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO LAY BEFORE THE SENATE A STATEMENT OF THE VALUE OF IMPORTS AND EXPORTS BETWEEN THE U.S., AND THAT PART OF THE ISLAND CALLED HAITI, ALSO THE AMOUNT OF TONNAGE EMPLOYED IN SUCH TRADE AND OF IMPORTATION DUTIES COLLECTED THEREON.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO LAY BEFORE THE SENATE COPIES OF CORRESPONDENCE BETWEEN HIM AND THE FRENCH MINISTER REGARDING THE TRADE CARRIED ON BY AMERICAN MERCHANTS TO HAITI.

TO REFER THE FOREIGN INTERCOURSE BILL WITH MESSAGE OF THE HOUSE, TO A SELECT COMMITTEE TO INQUIRE WHETHER W. FLORIDA WAS, OR WAS NOT, INCLUDED IN THE CESSION OF LOUISIANA TO THE U.S. BY THE TREATY WITH FRANCE, CONCLUDED APR. 30, 1803, TOGETHER WITH EVIDENCE SUBSTANTIATING SAME.
TO AMEND THE FOREIGN INTERCOURSE BILL BY ELIMINATING THE APPROPRIATION OF $2,000,000 WITH THE OBJECT OF REDUCING THE FIGURE TO $1,000,000.

TO AMEND THE FOREIGN INTERCOURSE BILL, BY ADDING A PROVISION FOR THE PURPOSE OF PURCHASING FROM THE SPANISH GOVERNMENT, THEIR TERRITORIES LYING ON THE ATLANTIC OCEAN AND GULF OF MEXICO AND EASTWARD OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.
TO PASS THE FOREIGN INTERCOURSE BILL.
TO PASS THE S. BILL (APP. FEB. 6, 1807, 6 STAT L. 63), WHICH PROVIDES THAT SETH HARDING, FORMERLY A CAPTAIN IN THE NAVY, BE PLACED ON THE PENSION LIST.

TO ADOPT THE FIRST RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE SPOLIATION OF OUR COMMERCE ON THE HIGH SEAS AND THE NEW PRINCIPLES ASSUMED BY BRITISH COURTS AND ADMIRALTY, AS A PRETEXT FOR THE CONDEMNATION OF OUR VESSELS IN THE PRIZE COURTS.

TO AMEND THE SECOND RESOLUTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF A REPORT OF THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE RELATIVE TO VIOLATION OF NEUTRAL RIGHTS, AND THE BRITISH IMPRESSMENT OF AMERICAN SEAMEN, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE FROM RESOLUTION "THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED TO DEMAND THE RESTORATION OF THE PROPERTY OF U.S. CITIZENS, CAPTURED ON THE PRETEXT OF ITS BEING EMPLOYED IN A TRADE WITH THE ENEMIES OF GREAT BRITIAN AND THE INDEMNIFICATION OF SUCH AMERICAN CITIZENS FOR THEIR LOSSES, SUSTAINED BY THOSE CAPTURES AND CONDEMNATIONS."

TO ADOPT THE SECOND RESOLUTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE REPORT OF THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE AND THE RESOLUTIONS SUBMITTED BY THEM, RELATIVE TO THE VIOLATION OF NEUTRAL RIGHTS AND THE BRITISH IMPRESSMENT OF AMERICAN SEAMEN, SAID SECOND RESOLUTION REQUESTS THE PRESIDENT TO DEMAND THE RESTORATION OF U.S. CITIZENS' PROPERTY CAPTURED ON THE PRETEXT OF ITS BEING EMPLOYED IN TRADE WITH ENEMIES OF GREAT BRITAIN, AND THE INDEMNIFICATIONS OF SUCH AMERICAN CITIZENS FOR THEIR LOSSES SUSTAINED, AND TO NEGOTIATE WITH THE BRITISH GOVERNMENT FOR THE SETTLEMENT OF OTHER DIFFERENCES.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT AS AMENDED TO THE HOUSE BILL REGARDING TRADING WITH ST. DOMINGO; SAID AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE CLEARANCE OF VESSELS FOR ANY PORT OF ST. DOMINGO NOT IN ACTUAL POSSESSION OF FRANCE, AND TO PREVENT THEIR TRADING WITH THOSE PORTS.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE TO ADOPT THE SECOND SECTION TO THE BILL REGARDING TRADING WITH ST. DOMINGO, SAID SECTION TO PROHIBIT THE CLEARANCE OF VESSELS FOR ANY PORT WITHIN THE ISLAND OF ST. DOMINGO NOT IN THE ACTUAL POSSESSION OF FRANCE.
TO PASS THE BILL RELATING TO TRADING WITH ST. DOMINGO.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE SENATE BILL FOR THE PROTECTION AND INDEMNIFICATION OF AMERICAN SEAMEN, UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. FEB. 28, 1806, 2 STAT L. 352) TO EXTEND THE POWERS OF THE GENERAL SURVEYOR TO THE TERRITORY OF LOUISIANA AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO PASS THE BILL TO CLASS THE MILITIA AND ASSIGN TO EACH CLASS ITS PARTICULAR DUTIES.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL, (APP. APR. 21, 1806, 2 STAT L 404) PROVIDING FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF COUNTERFEITING THE CURRENT COIN OF THE U.S.; SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE 4TH SECTION WHICH PROVIDES THAT IF ANY PERSON MAKES COUNTERFEIT GOLD OR SILVER COINS TO RESEMBLE ANY FOREIGN COINS, WITH AN INTENT TO MAKE PAYMENT WITH SAME, HE SHALL BE DEEMED GUILTY OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR AND UPON CONVICTION THEREOF SHALL PAY A FINE OF -- DOLLARS, OR SHALL BE IMPRISONED NOT EXCEEDING -- YEARS.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY (APP. MAY 22, 1807, 7 STAT L. 100) BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE PIANKESHAW TRIBE OF INDIANS, WHEREBY U.S. POSSESSIONS ON THE NORTH BANK OF THE OHIO RIVER ARE ENTIRELY CONSOLIDATED.
TO AMEND THE COUNTERFEITING BILL, SAID AMENDMENT TO MAKE THE FIRST SECTION, COVER COINS WHICH SHALL HEREAFTER BE MADE CURRENT, OR BE IN THE ACTUAL USE AND CIRCULATION AS MONEY IN THE U.S.
TO PASS THE COUNTERFEITING BILL AS AMENDED.
TO AMEND THE BILL PREVENTING THE ABUSE OF THE PRIVILEGES AND IMMUNITIES ENJOYED BY FOREIGN MINISTERS WITHIN THE U.S, BY STRIKING OUT THE FIRST SECTION OF THE BILL.
TO AMEND THE BILL REGARDING PRIVILEGES OF FOREIGN MINISTERS, BY STRIKING OUT THE ENTIRE SECOND SECTION OF THE BILL.
TO AMEND THE BILL "PRIVILEGES OF FOREIGN MINISTERS, BY ELIMINATING THE ENTIRE THIRD SECTION OF THE BILL.
TO PASS THE BILL REGARDING PRIVILEGES OF FOREIGN MINISTERS.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 3/29,1806, 6 STAT L. 61), AS AMENDED FOR THE RELIEF OF PETER LANDAIS, LATE CAPTAIN, OF AN ARMED U.S. VESSEL, CLAIMING PRIZE MONEY OCCURING FROM CAP- TURES MADE.

TO PASS THE BILL (APP. APR. 18, 1806, 2 STAT L. 381) AUTHORIZING THE STATE OF TENNESSEE TO ISSUE GRANTS AND PERFECT TITLES TO CERTAIN LANDS, THEREIN DESCRIBED, AND TO SETTLE THE CLAIMS TO THE VACANT AND UNAPPROPRIATED LAND WITHIN THE SAME.
TO CONFIRM THE APPOINTMENT OF JOHN ARMSTRONG AS COMMISSIONER PLENIPOTENTIARY AND EXTRAORDINARY, FOR SETTLING ALL MATTERS OF DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND SPAIN.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. MAR. 29, 1806, 2 STAT L. 356) WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE INCORPORATION OF THE TRUSTEES OF THE PRESBYTERIAN CONGREGATION OF GEORGETOWN.

TO PASS THE BILL (APP. APR. 21, 1806, 2 STAT L. 400) TO CARRY INTO EFFECT THE PROVISION OF THE EIGHTH SECTION OF THE ACT REGULATING THE GRANTS OF THE LANDS, AND PROVIDING FOR THE DISPOSAL OF THE LANDS OF THE U.S. SOUTH OF THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.

TO AGREE TO THAT PART OF THE REPORT OF THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE ON A BILL (APP. APR. 10. 1806, 2 STAT L. 359) FOR THE GOVERNANCE OF THE U.S. ARMY, WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE MANNER OF WEARING THE HAIR SHALL NOT BE SUBJECT TO THE RULES AND REGULATIONS OF THE ARMY.
TO CONFIRM THE APPOINTMENT OF SAMUEL HAMMOND AS A COLONEL IN THE U.S. ARMY.

TO RECOMMIT THE BILL (APP. APR. 21, 1806, 6 STAT 62) FOR THE RELIEF OF HAMET CARAMALLI, EX-BASHAW OF TRIPOLI SOLICITING FROM U.S. ATTENTION TO HIS SERVICES AND SUFFERINGS IN THE LATE WAR AGAINST THAT STATE, TOGETHER WITH THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE 17TH OF MARCH.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL (APP. APR. 18, 1806, 2 STAT 405) TO REPEAL SO MUCH OF ANY ACT OR ACTS AS AUTHORIZE THE RECEIPT OF EVIDENCES OF THE PUBLIC DEBT IN PAYMENT FOR LANDS OF THE U.S., AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES RELATIVE TO THE PUBLIC DEBT, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE FIRST SECTION WHICH PROVIDES THAT SO MUCH OF ANY ACT AS AUTHORIZED THE RECEIPT OF EVIDENCES OF THE PUBLIC DEBT IN PAYMENT FOR LANDS SHALL FROM AND AFTER APR. 30, 1806 BE REPEALED WITH CERTAIN CONDITIONS.

TO PASS THE BILL (APP. APR. 18, 1806, 2 STAT 405), TO REPEAL SO MUCH OF ANY ACT OR ACTS AS AUTHORIZE THE RECEIPT OF EVIDENCES OF THE PUBLIC DEBT IN PAYMENT FOR LANDS OF THE U.S., AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES RELATING TO THE PUBLIC DEBT, AS AMENDED.
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE HOUSE BILL (APP. FEB. 5, 1808, 2 STAT 457), AUTHORIZING THE ERECTION OF A BRIDGE OVER THE RIVER POTOMAC WITHIN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION (8 STAT L. 214) THAT FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE TREATY CONCLUDED AT TRIPOLI ON JUNE 3, 1805, BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE BASHAW BAY, AND SUBJECTS OF TRIPOLI, BE POSTPONED UNTIL THE NEXT SESSION OF CONGRESS, AND TO REQUEST THE PRESIDENT TO ASCERTAIN WHETHER WIFE AND CHILDREN OF HAMIT BASHAW HAVE BEEN DELIVERED TO HIM, AGREEABLY TO 3RD ARTICLE OF PRELIMINARY ARTICLES OF AFORESAID TREATY.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE SENATE BILL (APP. APR. 18, 1806, 2 STAT 379) PROHIBITING THE IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN GOODS, WARES, AND MERCHANDISE.

TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATIN ON THE BILL (APP. FEB. 5, 1808, 2 STAT L 457), AUTHORIZING THE ERECTION OF A BRIDGE OVER THE RIVER POTOMAC WITHIN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DEC. NEXT.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION (8 STAT L. 214) THAT FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF TREATY CONCLUDED AT TRIPOLI ON JUNE 3, 1805, BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE BASHAW BAY AND SUBJECTS OF TRIPOLI, BE POSTPONED UNTIL THE NEXT SESSION OF CONGRESS, AND TO REQUEST THE PRESIDENT TO ASCERTAIN WHETHER WIFE AND CHILDREN OF HAMIT BASHAW HAVE BEEN DELIVERED TO HIM, AGREEABLE TO THE 3RD ARTICLE OF PRELIMINARY ARTICLES OF AFORESAID TREATY; AMENDMENT TO INCLUDE THE FURTHER CONDITION THAT THE WIFE AND CHILDREN OF THE BASHAW, AND BROTHER OF THE BASHAW OF TRIPOLI, BE DELIVERED AGREEABLY TO THE 3RD ARTICLE OF SAID TREATY.
TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE TREATY (8 STAT L. 214) BETWEEN THE U.S. AND TRIPOLI, CONCLUDED AT TRIPOLI ON JUNE 3, 1805, UNTIL THE FIRST TUESDAY OF DECEMBER NEXT.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY (8 STAT L. 214) CONCLUDED AT TRIPOLI ON JUNE 3, 1805, BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE BASHAW BAY AND SUBJECTS OF TRIPOLI.
TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION ON THE BILL PROHIBITING THE OFFICERS OF THE ARMY AND NAVY FROM HOLDING OR EXERCISING ANY CIVIL OFFICE, UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER NEXT.

TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL (APP. APR. 18, 1806, 2 STAT 379) TO PROHIBIT THE IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN GOODS, WARES AND MERCHANDISE, IN ORDER TO BRING ABOUT A MORE FAVORABLE COURSE OF CONDUCT ON THE PART OF GREAT BRITAIN WITH RESPECT TO THE DISTURBANCE OF TRADE TO INSURE THAT GREAT BRITAIN WILL BE DISPOSED TO A MORE REASON- ABLE SETTLEMENT OF DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE TWO NATIONS, MOTION REJECTED.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. 4/18/1806, 2 STAT 379) TO PROHIBIT THE IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN GOODS, WARES, AND MERCHANDISE.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY (7 STAT 101, APP. MAY 22, 1807) ON JAN. 7, 1806, BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHEROKEE NATION OF INDIANS.

TO AMEND THE H.R. BILL (2 STAT L 440, APP. MAR. 3, 1807) TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR CARRYING INTO EFFECT A TREATY BE- TWEEN THE U.S. AND CHICKASAW INDIAN TRIBE; SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE THIRD READING.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION THAT THE COMMUNICATIONS ACCOMPANYING THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE OF APR. 18, 1806, BE RETURNED TO HIM, AND HE BE REQUESTED TO RENEW NEGOTIATIONS WITH THE ENVOY OF THE BAY OF TUNIS TO SETTLE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THAT COUNTRY AND THE U.S., TO REDRESS THE INJURIES WHICH THE BAY CLAIMS WERE RECEIVED FROM THE U.S. SQUADRON IN THE MEDITERRANEAN; SAID AMENDMENT PROPOSING TO DEFEAT THE MOTION THAT THE PRES. BE REQUESTED TO RENEW THE NEGOTIATIONS WITH THE ENVOY OF THE BAY OF TUNIS.

TO AMEND THE S. BILL (APP. MAR. 3, 1807, 2 STAT 436) REPEALING THE DUTIES ON SALT, BUT TO CONTINUE IN FORCE FOR A FURTHER TIME THE FIRST SECTION OF THE ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT FURTHER TO PROTECT THE COMMERCE AND SEAMEN OF U.S. AGAINST BARBARY POWERS,", SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE FIRST SECTION.
TO EXPUNGE EVERYTHING IN THE JOURNAL RELATIVE TO THE MEMORIALS OF S.G. OGDEN, AND WILLIAM S. SMITH.

TO ADOPT THE H.R. RESOLUTION (APP. MAR. 19, 1806, 2 STAT L 411) REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO LAY BEFORE THE SENATE SUCH INFORMATION, DOCUMENTS, PAPERS AND CORRESPONDENCE AS MAY BE IN HIS POWER, AND WHICH HE MAY THINK UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES PROPER TO COMMUNICATE, RESPECTING THE SUBJECT OF HIS MESSAGE OF DEC. 3RD INST. IN WHICH A TEMPORARY SUSPENSION OF THE ACT OF THE LAST SESSION PROHIBITING CERTAIN IMPORTATIONS IS RECOMMENDED.
TO POSTPONE A SECOND READING OF THE BILL, AUTHORIZING THE ERECTION OF A BRIDGE OVER THE POTOMAC RIVER WITHIN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS THE BILL WHICH PROVIDES THAT LANDS CEDED TO THE U.S. MUST NOT BE MADE AVAILABLE FOR SETTLEMENT UNLESS AUTHORIZED BY LAW.

TO AMEND AS IN COMM. OF THE WHOLE, THE H.R. BILL (APP. MAR. 3, 18047, 2 STAT L 437) FOR REPEAL OF ACTS LAYING DUTIES ON SALT AND CONTINUING IN FORCE THE FIRST SECTION OF THE ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT FURTHER TO PROTECT THE COMMERCE AND SEAMEN OF THE U.S. AGAINST THE BARBARY POWERS", SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT CERTAIN PARTS OF SECTIONS 1, 2, AND 3 OF THE ACT, SO AS TO PROVIDE FOR THE REPEAL OF ANY ACT LAYING DUTIES ON SALT, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT AS IN THE COMM. OF THE WHOLE ON THE BILL, "AN ACT REPEALING ACTS LAYING DUTIES ON SALT, ETC," SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT CERTAIN PARTS AND WORDS FROM SECTION 1, 2, AND 3, IN ORDER TO REPEAL THAT PART OF THE ACT WHICH RELATES TO THE DUTIES ON SALT, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

TO ADD AN AMENDMENT TO THE BILL,  "AN ACT REPEALING ACTS LAYING DUTIES ON SALT, ETC.," AS A NEW SECTION OF THE BILL; SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT FROM AND AFTER JANUARY 1ST NEXT, SO MUCH OF ANY ACT THAT LAYS A DUTY ON IMPORTED SALT, AND ALLOWS A BOUNTY ON EXPORTED SALTED PROVISIONS AND PICKLED FISH, IN LIEU OF DRAWBACK OF THE DUTIES ON THE SALT SALT USED IN CURING THE SAME, AND SO MUCH OF ANY ACT WHICH MAKES ALLOWANCES TO OWNERS AND CREWS OF FISHING VESSELS, IN OF DRAWBACK OF DUTIES PAID ON SALT USED BY SAME, SHALL BE, AND IS HEREBY, REPEALED.
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL "AN ACT REPEALING ACTS LAYING DUTIES ON SALT, ETC.,"
TO PASS THE AMENDED BILL "AN ACT REPEALING DUTIES ON SALT, ETC."
TO ADHERE TO SENATE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL REPEALING ACTS LAYING DUTIES ON SALT.
TO PASS THE AMENDED BILL FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF COMMISSIONERS TO ASCERTAIN THE PRACTICABILITY OF REMOVING OBSTRUCTIONS IN NAVIGATION ON OHIO RIVER AT THE RAPIDS TO MAKE THEM SAFE FOR NAVIGATION.
TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF WILLIAM CLARKE OF INDIANA, NOW 1ST LIEUTENANT, TO BE LIEUTENANT COLONEL IN THE 2ND REGIMENT, TO SUCCEED THOMAS CUSHING.
TO DECIDE IF IT IS IN ORDER TO READ A BILL A 2ND TIME, AS A BILL OF A SIMILAR NATURE HAD BEEN REJECTED DURING THIS SESSION OF CONGRESS; SAID BILLS RELATING TO REPEALING OF THE DUTIES ON SALT, ETC.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SEC. OF THE TREASURY REPORT TO THE SENATE A PLAN FOR THE OPENING OF ROADS AND CANALS TOGETHER WITH A STATEMENT OF THE UNDERTAKINGS OF THAT NATURE WHICH, AS OBJECTS OF PUBLIC IMPROVEMENT MAY REQUIRE AND DESERVE THE AID OF GOVERNMENT; ALSO A STATEMENT OF WORKS OF THIS NATURE WHICH HAVE BEEN INAUGURATED, PROGRESS MADE, MEANS AND PROSPECTS OF THEIR COMPLETION, AND SUCH OTHER INFORMATION WHICH IN THE OPINION OF THE SECRETARY WOULD BE HELPFUL TO CONGRESS COVERING THE OBJECT OF HIS RESOLUTION.

TO AMEND THE BILL REPEALING DUTIES ON SALT BY STRIKING OUT THE THIRD SECTION, SAID SECTION PROPOSING THAT "AN ACT TO FURTHER PROTECT THE COMMERCE AND SEAMEN OF THE U.S. AGAINST THE BARBARY POWERS", AS IS CONTAINED IN THE FIRST SECTION OF THE SAID ACT BE, AND THE SAME IS HEREBY CONTINUED IN FORCE UNTIL 1ST DAY OF JANUARY NEXT, AND NO LONGER, PROVIDED HOWEVER, THAT THE ADDITIONAL DUTY LAID BY SAID SECTION SHALL BE COLLECTED ON ALL GOODS, WARES, AND MERCHANDISE LIABLE TO PAY THE SAME AS SHALL HAVE BEEN IMPORTED TO THAT DAY.

TO ADOPT THE REPORT OF THE COMM. OF THE WHOLE ON THE BILL REPEALING ACTS LAYING DUTIES ON SALT; SAID REPORT PROPOSES THAT AFTER DEC. 31 NEXT, SO MUCH OF ANY ACT LAYING A DUTY ON IMPORTED SALT BE REPEALED, THUS EXTENDING THE DATE FOR SUCH REPEAL FROM SEPT. 30 TO DEC. 31.
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL REPEALING DUTIES ON SALT.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. MAR. 3, 1807, 6 STAT 65), WHICH AUTHORIZES THE SETTLEMENT OF ACCOUNTS BETWEEN THE U.S. AND WILLIAM EATON.

TO AMEND A MOTION TO SUSPEND THE 12TH RULE, REQUIRING EVERY BILL TO RECEIVE THREE READINGS PREVIOUS TO BEING PASSED ON THREE DIFFERENT DAYS UNLESS UNAMINOUSLY DIRECTED OTHERWISE, FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE SESSION, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE WORDS: "FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE SESSION," AND INSERT THE WORDS, "ABOLISHED."
TO SUSPEND THE 12TH RULE, REQUIRING EVERY BILL TO RECEIVE THREE READINGS PREVIOUS TO BEING PASSED ON THREE DIFFERENT DAYS, UNLESS UNANIMOUSLY DIRECTED OTHERWISE, FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE SESSION.
TO PASS THE BILL REPEALING DUTIES ON SALT.

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L.484, APP. 4/19/1808), FOR THE PRESERVATION OF PEACE, AND MAINTENANCE OF AUTHORITY OF THE UNITED STATES IN PORTS, HARBORS, AND WATERS UNDER THEIR JURISDICTION, BY ELIMINATING THE 15TH SECTION AND A PART OF THE 5TH SECTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT AT HIS DISCRETION, TO CLOSE THE PORTS AND HARBORS TO ALL ARMED BRITISH VESSELS, EXCEPT THOSE IN DISTRESS OR CHARGED WITH DISPATCHES OR OFFICIAL BUSINESS FROM THEIR GOVERNMENT.
TO PASS THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 453, APP. 1/8/1808), SUPPLE- MENTARY TO AN ACT FOR FORTIFYING THE PORTS AND HARBORS AND FOR BUILDING GUNBOATS.

TO REFER THE MEMORIAL OF THE MERCHANTS AND OTHERS OF THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA RELATIVE TO MODIFICATION, OR REPEAL, OF AN ACT PROHIBITING THE IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN GOODS, WARES, AND MERCHANDISE, (APP. 4/18/1806), TO A SELECT COMMITTEE.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE H. R. BILL (2 STAT. L. 451, APP. 12/22/1807), LAYING AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL TOMORROW, THE H. R. BILL (2 STAT. L. 451, APP. 12/22/1807), LAYING AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS THE H. R. BILL (2 STAT. L. 451, APP. 12/22/1807), LAYING AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS OR HARBORS OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 453, APP. 1/8/1808), ENTITLED "AN ACT SUPPLEMENTORY TO AN ACT", "FOR FORTIFYING THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE U. S. AND FOR BUILDING GUNBOATS", BY SPECIFYING THE EXPENDITURE AND ALLOTMENTS OF APPROPRIATIONS TO THE VARIOUS STATES.

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 455, APP. 1/9/1808), ENTITLED, "AN ACT EXTENDING THE RIGHT OF SUFFRAGE IN THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES," BY ELIMINATING FROM SEC- TION 1 THE PROVISION THAT, A COUNTY OR TERRITORIAL TAX MUST HAVE BEEN PAID AND ASSESSED AT LEAST 6 MONTHS PREVIOUS TO SUCH ELECTIONS, AND INSERTING THEREFORE THE WORDS, "THAT THEY WHO HAVE LEGAL OR EQUITABLE TITLE TO LAND, BY VIRTUE OF ACT OF CONGRESS, OR WHO MAY BECOME PURCHASERS OF LAND FROM THE UNITED STATES OF 50 ACRES, OR WHO MAY OWN A TOWN LOT OF ONE HUNDRED DOLLAR VALUE."

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 455, APP. 1/9/1808), EXTENDING THE RIGHT OF SUFFRAGE TO THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY INSERTING A PROVISION THAT, "THIS ACT SHALL NOT TAKE EFFECT WITHOUT THE ASSENT OF THE GEORGIA STATE LEGISLATURE".
TO PASS AS AMENDED THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 455, APP. 1/9/1808), EXTENDING THE RIGHT OF SUFFRAGE IN THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

TO AMEND A HOUSE BILL (2 STAT.L. 413, APP. 1/9/1808), AN ACT SUPPLEMENTARY TO AN ACT LAYING AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE U.S.; SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT NEVER AFTER OWNERS OF VESSELS HAVE CLEARED A PORT OF THE UNITED STATES, SHALL A CREDIT FOR DUTIES ON ANY GOODS, WARES, OR MERCHANDISE IMPORTED BY THEM INTO ANY U. S. PORTS, BE ALLOWED.
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION THAT JOHN SMITH OF OHIO BE ALLOW- ED COUNSEL, TO SHOW CAUSE WHY HE SHOULD NOT BE EXPELLED FROM THE SENATE FOR HIS PARTICIPATION IN THE CONSPIRACY OF AARON BURR.
TO FURNISH COPIES OF THE MINUTES OF THE COMMITTEE INQUIRING INTO THE CONDUCT OF JOHN SMITH OF OHIO, AS WELL AS THE CORRESPONDENCE BETWEEN THEM AND HIMSELF.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION, INQUIRING INTO THE CONDUCT OF JOHN SMITH OF OHIO, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION THAT THE TAKING OF TESTIMONY BEGIN ON MARCH 1.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO BEGIN TAKING TESTIMONY AND HEARING WITNESSES IN THE INQUIRY INTO THE CONDUCT OF JOHN SMITH OF OHIO, ON MARCH1.

TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE ISSUE A SUMMONS TO ELIAS GLOVER AND WILLIAM MC FARLAND TO APPEAR BEFORE THE SENATE ON THE FIRST OF MARCH NEXT, AND GIVE TEST- IMONY IN THE CASE OF JOHN SMITH, A SENATOR FROM OHIO, REGAR- DING HIS ALLEGED PARTICIPATION IN THE CONSPIRACY OF AARON BURR.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY OF DECEMBER NEXT FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL TO EXTINGUISH THE CLAIMS OF THE UNITED STATES TO CERTAIN BALANCES REPORTED TO BE DUE FROM SEVERAL STATES.
TO PASS THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 457, APP. 2/5/1808), AS AMENDED AUTHORIZING THE CONSTRUCTION OF A BRIDGE OVER THE POTOMAC RIVER IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHOCTAW NATION OF INDIANS, CONCLUDED ON 11/16/1805.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED UNITED STATES AND THE OTTAWA, CHIPPEWA, WYANDOT AND POTAWATTOMIE NATIONS OF INDIANS, MADE ON 11/17/1807.
TO READ THE MEMORIAL OF D. LUDLOW AND OTHERS, PURCHASERS OF LAND IN GEORGIA, REQUESTING THAT THE CLAIMS BE BROUGHT BE- FORE THE SUPREME COURT FOR JUDGEMENT OF COMPENSATION.

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 477, APP. 3/22/1808), BY ESTABLISHING CIRCUIT COURTS, BY ELIMINATING THE SECOND SEC- TION FIXING THE SALARY OF THE DISTRICT JUDGE OF THE DISTRICT OF OHIO AT $1,500 ANNUALLY.
TO CONFIRM THE APPOINTMENT OF WILLIAM PINCKNEY AS MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY AT LONDON.

TO AMEND THE BILL FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF TREASON AND OTHER CRIMES AND OFFENSES AGAINST THE UNITED STATES BY STRIKING OUT THE FIRST SECTION PROVIDING DEATH PENALTY FOR ANY PERSON OWING ALLEGIANCE TO THE UNITED STATES WHO HAS INTENTIONS TO FORCIBLY OVERTURN, OR CHANGE THE GOVERNMENT OR FORCIBLY TAKE POSSESSION OF ANY FORT, MAGAZINE, NAVY YARD.

TO AMEND A BILL (2 STAT. L. 476, APP. 3/13/1808), ENTITLED, "AN ACT REMITTING THE DUTIES PAYABLE ON THE IMPORTATION OF A MONUMENT TO BE ERECTED IN MEMORY OF THE OFFICERS OF THE U. S. NAVY WHO FELL DURING THE ATTACK MADE ON THE CITY OF TRIPOLI, IN 1804;" SAID AMENDMENT TO ADD A SECOND SECTION AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF THE NAVY TO CAUSE SAID MONUMENT TO BE ERECTED IN A PLACE TO BE DESIGNATED BY THE PRESIDENT AND AUTHORIZING THE TREASURY TO APPROPRIATE SUCH MONIES TO COMPLETE ITS CONSTRUCTION AS MAY NOT BE DONATED FROM OTHER SOURCES.

TO POSTPONE UNTIL MONDAY WEEK CONSIDERATION OF THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE GIVING JOHN SMITH OF OHIO MORE TIME TO PREPARE HIS DEFENSE AGAINST THE CHARGE OF HAVING PARTICIPATED IN THE AARON BURR CONSPIRACY.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST DAY OF APRIL CONSIDERATION OF THE CASE OF JOHN SMITH OF OHIO, IN ORDER TO GIVE HIM AMPLE TIME TO PREPARE HIS DEFENSE.
TO CONFIRM THE REAPPOINTMENT OF WILLIAM HULL AS GOVERNOR OF THE TERRITORY OF MICHIGAN.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER NEXT CONSI- DERATION OF THE BILL AUTHORIZING THE ISSUANCE OF DEBEN- TURES.
TO PASS THE BILL TO PUNISH TREASON AND OTHER CRIMES AND OFFENCES AGAINST THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL CONCERNING COURTS MARTIAL AND COURTS OF INQUIRY, BY STRIKING OUT FROM LINE FIVE OF SECTION ONE THE FOLLOWING WORDS, "OR COURT OF INQUIRY".

TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION THAT JOHN SMITH, BY HIS PARTICIPATION IN THE CONSPIRACY OF AARON BURR AGAINST THE PEACE, UNION, AND LIBERTIES OF THE PEOPLE OF THE U. S., HAS BEEN FOUND GUILTY OF CONDUCT IMCOMPATIBLE WITH DUTIES AS A SENATOR AND THAT HE SHOULD BE EXPELLED FROM THE SENATE.
TO PASS THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 484, APP. 4/21/1808), CONCERN- ING PUBLIC CONTRACTS.

TO AMEND THE BILL CONCERNING COURTS MARTIAL AND COURTS OF INQUIRY, BY ADDING A SIXTH SECTION, TO THE EFFECT THAT, NO JUDGE SHALL AUTHORIZE ISSUANCE OF A SUBPOENA, TO SUMMON ANY CITIZEN TO APPEAR BEFORE ANY COURT MARTIAL, OR COURT OF INQUIRY, EXCEPT IN CASES WHERE THE CHARGE AGAINST AN OFFICER OR SOLDIER BE FOR A BREACH OF SOME ONE OR MORE OF THE ARTI- CLES OF WAR.
TO PASS THE BILL ENTITLED "AN ACT CONCERNING COURTS-MARTIAL AND COURTS OF INQUIRY".
TO RATIFY THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHEROKEE TRIBE OF INDIANS, CONCLUDED ON 9/11/1807.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY WITH AMENDMENTS, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE SIOUX TRIBE OF INDIANS, MADE AT THE MOUTH OF RIVER ST. PETERS, ON 9/23/1805.

TO AMEND THE BILL (APP. 4/21/1808), AUTHORIZING THE PRESI- DENT TO SUSPEND OPERATION OF THE ACT LAYING AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE U. S., AND THE SEVERAL ACTS SUPPLEMENTARY THERETO; WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES SECTION ONE AND INSERTS A PROVISION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO MODIFY OR SUSPEND THE EMBARGO SHOULD HOSTI- LITIES BETWEEN THE BELLIGERENT EUROPEAN POWERS CEASE.

TO PASS THE BILL (APP. 4/21/1808), AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO SUSPEND OPERATION OF THE ACT LAYING AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE U. S., AND THE SEVERAL ACTS SUPPLEMENTARY THERETO.
TO AMEND THE "EMBARGO ACT", BY ELIMINATING THE WORD "PORT" AND SUBSTITUTING THE WORD "DISTRICT" IN SECTION ONE, LINE TEN.

TO AMEND "EMBARGO ACT", BY ELIMINATING THE FIRST SECTION ORDERING ALL VESSELS AND SHIPS LEAVING AMERICAN PORTS, RE- GARDLESS OF DESTINATION, TO OBTAIN CLEARANCE BY FILING A MANIFEST WITH THE COLLECTOR OF THE PORT OF THE CARGO ABOARD; ALSO, THAT WITHIN THIRTY DAYS AFTER LEAVING PORT THE OWNERS, AGENTS, OR MASTERS OF SUCH VESSELS FILE A CERTIFICATE OF LANDING SUCH CARGO IN A PORT OF THE UNITED STATES, SIGNED BY THE COLLECTOR OR SURVEYOR OF SUCH PORT.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING ON H. R. BILL "EMBAR- GO ACT".
TO PASS THE H. R. BILL "EMBARGO ACT" AS AMENDED.
TO FIX THE DATE FOR THE NEXT MEETING OF CONGRESS.

TO AMEND THE BILL, PROVIDING FOR THE ARMING OF AMERICAN VES- SELS, BY ELIMINATING LINES 3 AND 4 FROM THE FIRST SECTION, THUS LEAVING THE DECISION OF USING THE ARMED VESSELS TO THE CONGRESS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS THE BILL ENTITLED "AN ACT MAKING PROVISION FOR ARM- ING AND EQUIPING THE WHOLE BODY OF MILITIA OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS THE BILL REQUIRING THE PRESIDENT TO PREPARE THE FRIGATES AND VESSELS OF THE COUNTRY FOR SERVICE.

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 499, APP. 4/25/1808), TO MAKE GOOD A DEFICIT IN THE APPROPRIATION OF 1807 FOR COMPLETING THE PUBLIC BUILDINGS, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE FROM THE FIRST SECTION THAT PART AUTHORIZING AN APPROPRIATION OF $14,000 FOR REPAIRS AND ALTERATIONS TO THE PRESIDENT'S HOME.

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 499, APP. 4/25/1808), BY IN- SERTING AT THE END OF THE FIRST SECTION A CLAUSE AUTHORIZING AN APPROPRIATION OF $11,500 TO COMPLETE THE REPAIRS AND ALTERATIONS IN THE INTERIOR OF THE SOUTH WING OF THE PRESI- DENT'S HOME, SAID BILL TO MAKE GOOD A DEFICIT IN THE APPRO- PRIATIONS OF 1807 FOR COMPLETING THE PUBLIC BUILDINGS.
TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE FOR CONSIDERATION AND REPORT, THE RESOLUTION TO REPEAL THE ACTS LAYING AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION THAT THE EMBARGO ACTS BE REPEALED AND THAT A COMMITTEE BE APPOINTED TO PREPARE AND REPORT A BILL FOR THAT PURPOSE.
TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL MAKING FURTHER PROVISION FOR ENFORCING THE EMBARGO ACT.
TO PASS THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 506, APP. 1/9/1809), TO EN- FORCE AND MAKE MORE EFFECTIVE THE "EMBARGO ACTS".

TO AMEND FIRST PART OF THE FIRST SECTION AFTER THE WORD "ASSEMBLED", IN THE SECOND LINE OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTA- TIVES BILL (2 STAT. L. 514, APP. 1/31/1809), AUTHORIZING THE EMPLOYMENT OF AN ADDITIONAL NAVAL FORCE; SAID AMENDMENT TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO FIT OUT, MAN AND OFFICER ALL THE FRIGATES AND OTHER ARMED VESSELS, AS SOON AS THEY CAN BE PREPARED FOR ACTUAL SERVICE, TO BE STATIONED AT SUCH PORTS AND PLACES ON THE SEACOAST AS HE MAY DEEM MOST EXPEDIENT.

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 537, APP. 3/3/1809), WHICH PROVIDES FOR FURTHER APPROPRIATIONS TOWARD COMPLETING THE TWO WINGS OF THE CAPITAL AT THE CITY OF WASHINGTON, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES; SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE WORDS, "CARRYING UP IN SOLID WORK, AND REPAIRING THE WEST SIDE OF THE NORTH WING, PROVIDING PERMANENT PERMANENT ACCOMADATIONS FOR THE LIBRARY".

TO AMEND THE BILL FOR COMPLETION OF THE CAPITOL, BY STRIKING OUT THE WORDS "AND SQUARE" OUT OF THE CLAUSE, "FOR IMPROVE- MENTS AND REPAIRS OF THE PRESIDENT'S HOUSE AND SQUARE, IN- CLUDING A CARRIAGE HOUSE".

TO AMEND THE BILL FOR COMPLETION OF THE CAPITOL, BY STRIKING OUT THE WORDS "THAT THE ROAD ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE PRESI- DENT'S SQUARE, BE FINISHED, USING GRAVEL, WITH A BRIDGE OF STONE AND BRICK, ACROSS THE TIBER, ON THE NORTH SIDE OF PENN. AVE., BE CONSTRUCTED AT A COST OF ---- DOLLARS".

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO LAY UPON THE SENATE ALL CORRESPONDENCE BETWEEN MR. ROSE, LATE BRITISH MINISTER TO THE UNITED STATES, AND THE SECRETARY OF STATE OR ANY OTHER OFFICER OF THE GOVERNMENT, BY ADDING A PREAMBLE, THAT A MEMBER OF THE SENATE HAS STATED THAT IN ADDITION TO THE FORMAL NEGOTIATIONS WITH THE BRITISH GOVERNMENT THERE HAVE BEEN CERTAIN INFORMAL OVERTURES RELATING TO THE ATTACK MADE ON THE FRIGATE CHESAPEAKE, WHICH OVERTURES AND THEIR RESULT SHOULD BE KNOWN TO THE PEOPLE.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO LAY UPON THE SENATE ALL CORRESPONDENCE BETWEEN MR. ROSE, LATE BRITISH MINISTER TO THE UNITED STATES, AND THE SECRETARY OF STATE OR ANY OTHER OFFICER OF THE GOVERNMENT, RELATING TO THE ATTACK MADE ON THE FRIGATE CHESAPEAKE.

TO AMEND THE H. R. AMENDMENT TO THE H. R. BILL (2 STAT. L. 506, APP. 1/9/1809), TO ENFORCE AND MAKE MORE EFFECTIVE THE EMBARGO ACT, SAID AMENDMENT TO READ: "THAT WHERE A BOND HAS BEEN GIVEN TO THE U. S. WITH CONDITION THAT CERTAIN GOODS, OR CARGO OF A VESSEL, SHALL BE RELANDED IN SOME PORTS OF THE U. S., A CERTIFICATE TO THE EFFECT FROM THE COLLECTOR OF THE PROPER PORT MUST BE SHOWN TO THE COLLECTOR OF THE PORT FROM WHICH THE VESSEL CLEARED, ON FAILURE WHEREOF THE BOND SHALL BE PUT IN SUIT AND JUDGEMENT SHALL BE GIVEN AGAINST THE DE- FENDANT; IN CASE OF LOSS OF CARGO WAS BEYOND THE OWNERS' OR MASTERS' CONTROL, THE CREW MUST BE PRODUCED AT THE TRIAL, IF LIVING.

TO AMEND A H. R. AMENDMENT TO THE BILL (2 STAT. 506, APP. 1/9/1809), TO ENFORCE AND MAKE MORE EFFECTIVE THE EMBARGO ACT, SAID AMENDMENT TO READ, THAT ANY PERSON AGGRIEVED BY THE ACTS OF ANY COLLECTOR MAY FILE A PETITION BEFORE THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE DISTRICT WHEREIN THE COLLECTOR RESIDES PROVIDED NOTHING HEREIN CONTAINED SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO DE- PRIVE THE PARTY AGGRIEVED OF HIS RIGHT OF TRIAL ACCORDING TO THE RULES OF THE COMMON LAW, AS PRACTICED IN THE STATE WHERE THE PARTIES RESIDE.

TO CONCUR IN THE H. R. AMENDMENT TO THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 506 APP. 1/9/1809), TO ENFORCE AND MAKE MORE EFFECTIVE THE EM- BARGO ACT, SAID AMENDMENT PROPOSES THAT ANY PERSON AGGRIEVED BY THE ACTS OF ANY COLLECTOR MAY FILE HIS PETITION BEFORE THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE DISTRICT WHEREIN THE COLLECTOR RESIDES; IF THE COURT SHALL ADJUDGE FOR THE PETITION, BOND, AND SURETY MUST BE GIVEN BEFORE THE PERMISSION TO LOAD CARGO IS DECREED IF THE COURT ADJUDGE AGAINST THE PETITIONER THE COLLECTOR SHALL BE ENTITLED TO TREBLE COSTS, WHICH SHALL BE TAXED FOR HIM AND EXECUTION AWARDED ACCORDINGLY BY THE COURT.
TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE ACT (2 STAT. L. 506, APP. 1/9/1809), TO ENFORCE AND MAKE MORE EFFECTUAL THE EMBARGO ACT, TO THE FIRST MONDAY IN NOV. NEXT.

TO AMEND A H. R. AMENDMENT TO THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 506, APP. 1/9/1809), TO ENFORCE AND MAKE MORE EFFECTUAL THE EMBARGO ACT; SAID AMENDMENT WOULD PLACE UNDER THE DIRECT CONTROL OF THE PRESIDENT, AND NOT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY, 30 ARMED VESSELS TO ENFORCE THE LAWS OF THE U. S. ON THE SEA COAST.

TO AGREE TO THE H. R. AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE BILL (2 STAT. L. 506, APP. 1/9/1809), TO ENFORCE AND MAKE MORE EFFECTUAL THE EMBARGO ACT, SAID AMENDMENT TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO HIRE, ARM, AND EMPLOY THIRTY VESSELS NOT EXCEEDING 130 TONS EACH, BELONGING TO U. S. CITIZENS TO ENFORCE THE LAWS OF THE UNITED STATES ON THE SEA-COAST THEREOF, AND TO DIS- MISS THE SAME FROM SERVICE WHENEVER HE SHALL DEEM THE SAME EXPEDIENT.

TO AGREE TO H. R. AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE BILL (2 STAT. L. 506, APP. 1/9/1809), TO ENFORCE AND MAKE MORE EFFECTUAL THE EMBARGO ACT, SAID AMENDMENT PROPOSING THAT THE POWERS GIVEN THE PRESIDENT BY THE 7TH SECTION OF THE ACT OF MARCH 12, 1808, TO GRANT PERMISSION TO CITIZENS HAVING PROPERTY OF VALUE IN PLACES WITHOUT THE JURISDICTION OF THE UNITED STATES TO DISPATCH VESSELS FOR THE SAME, SHALL HENCEFORTH CEASE.

TO AMEND THE H. R. BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO AN ACT MORE EFFECT- UALLY TO PROVIDE FOR THE NATIONAL DEFENSE BY ESTABLISHING A UNIFORM MILITIA, BY ELIMINATING THAT CLAUSE IN SECTION 2, WHICH AUTHORIZES THE PRESIDENT TO ORDER A MOTTO OR DEVICE PAINTED ON MARINE MILITIA VESSELS.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE SENATE REFUSED TO READ A SECOND TIME THE H. R. BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE TRANSPORTATION OF CERTAIN DOCUMENTS BY MAIL, FREE OF POSTAGE.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL MAKING FURTHER PROVISION FOR THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS, THE AMENDMENT STRIKING OUT THE PART WHICH PROPOSED THAT THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS, CONSTITUTING THE MILITARY ACADEMY, SHALL BE REMOVED FROM WEST POINT, AND STATIONED AT WASHINGTON D. C.

TO RECEDE FROM THE AMENDMENT TO THE H. R. BILL (2 STAT. L. 514, APP. 1/31/1809), AUTHORIZING THE EMPLOYMENT OF AN ADDI- TIONAL NAVAL FORCE, SAID AMENDMENT PROPOSING THAT THERE BE FITTED OUT, OFFICERED, MANNED, AND EMPLOYED, ALL U. S. FRI- GATES, OTHER ARMED VESSELS, AND GUNBOATS, AND STATIONED AT EXPEDIENT PORTS ON THE SEA COAST.

TO AMEND THE H. R. BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF SICK, DISABLED, DISTRESSED SEAMEN, BY STRIKING OUT THAT PART WHICH PROPOSES THAT CERTAIN SUMS OF MONEY SHALL BE REFUNDED TO THE TREASURY OUT OF SUCH SURPLUS AS MAY OCCURE TO THE FUND FOR THE RELIEF OF SEAMEN.
TO AMEND THE H. R. BILL WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE RELIEF OF SICK, DISABLED, AND DISTRESSED SEAMEN, BY STRIKING OUT THE WORDS "AND DISTRESSED", AFTER THE WORD "DISABLED".
TO ADHERE TO THE AMENDMENT AGREEING TO THE REPORT OF THE CONFEREES, REGARDING THE HOUSE BILL (2 STAT. L. 514, APP. 1/31/1809), AUTHORIZING THE EMPLOYMENT OF ADDITIONAL NAVAL FORCE.
TO CONFIRM APPOINTMENT, MADE DURING RECESS OF CONGRESS, OF WILLIAM DUANE, AS LIEUTENANT-COLONEL OF THE RIFLEMEN CORPS.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL WHICH AUTHORIZES THE SALE AND GRANT OF A CERTAIN QUANTITY OF PUBLIC LAND TO THE CHESAPEKE AND DELAWARE AND OHIO CANAL, BY STRIKING OUT THE SIXTH SECTION WHICH PROPOSES THAT A QUANTITY OF LAND SHALL BE SOLD AND GRANTED TO THE OHIO CANAL CO., AT THE RATE, AND SUBJECT TO ALL RULES, REGULATIONS AND CONDITIONS OF THE GRANT MADE BY THIS BILL TO THE CHESAPEKE AND DELAWARE CANAL CO., TO BE LO- CATED ON ANY OF THE PUBLIC LANDS OF THE UNITED STATES IN THE INDIANA TERRITORY, IN THE MANNER PROVIDED FOR THE SAID CHESAPEKE AND DELAWARE CANAL CO.
TO CONFIRM THE APPOINTMENT OF GENERAL HENRY DEARBORN AS COLLECTOR OF THE DISTRICT OF BOSTON, MASS.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION (2 STAT. L. 528, APP. 3/1/1809), THAT THE SEVERAL LAWS LAYING AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE U. S. BE REPEALED ON MARCH 4TH NEXT; BY STRIKING OUT THE WORDS EXCEPTING ENGLAND AND FRANCE FROM THE REPEAL OF THE EMBARGO AND PROVIDING A LAW PROHIBITING COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE WITH THESE NATIONS.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SEVERAL LAWS LAYING AN EM- BARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE UNITED STATES BE REPEALED MARCH 4, NEXT, EXCEPT AS TO GREAT BRITIAN AND FRANCE AND THEIR DEPENDENCIES, AND THAT PROVISIONS BE MADE BY LAW FOR PROHIBITING ALL COMMERCIAL IN- TERCOURSE WITH THOSE NATIONS.
TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 544, APP. 3/3/1809), AUTHORIZ- ING AN AUGMENTATION OF THE MARINE CORP, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF ONE MORE MAJOR.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL (2 STAT. L. 528, APP. 3/1/1809), FOR INTERDICTION OF THE COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE U.S., GREAT BRITAIN AND FRANCE AND THEIR DEPENDENCIES, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THAT PART OF THE BILL WHICH PROPOSES TO HAVE THE U.S. GOV'T ISSUE, UNDER SUITABLE PLEDGES AND PRECAUTIONS, LETTERS OF MARQUE AND REPRISAL, AGAINST THE NATION CONTINUING IN FORCE ITS UN- LAWFUL EDICTS AGAINST THE COMMERCE OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS THE COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BILL.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE H. R. BILL TO IMPOSE ADDITIONAL DUTIES UPON ALL STOCKS, WARES, AND MER- CHANDISE IMPORTED FROM FOREIGN PLACES, EXCEPT IN ANY VESSEL WHICH CLEARED FROM THE UNITED STATES PRIOR TO DEC. 22, 1807, FROM ANY PORT OR PLACE NOT IN EUROPE OR THE WEST INDIES.
TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE ADDITIONAL DUTIES ACT UNTIL FIRST MONDAY OF JUNE NEXT.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHIPPEWA, OTTAWA, WYANDOT, AND OTHER NATIONS OF INDIANS, MADE AT BROWNSTOWN, MICHIGAN ON 11/25/1808.
TO CONFIRM THE APPOINTMENT OF WILLIAM SHORT AS MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY TO THE COURT OF ST. PETERSBURGH.

TO AMEND THE BILL (2 STAT. L. 535, APP. 3/3/1809), ESTAB- LISHING TREASURY, WAR AND NAVY DEPARTMENTS, BY ADDING "ADD" TO THE END OF THE THIRD SECTION, "THAT EVERY AGENT OF THE U. S. SHALL MAKE HIS PAYMENTS ON ACCOUNT OF THE UNITED STATES IN THE SAME DESCRIPTION OF MONEY OR BANK BILLS WHICH HE MAY RECEIVE FROM THE TREASURY, WHENEVER PRACTICABLE, AND IF IMPRACTICABLE, IN SPECIE OR BANK BILLS OF VALUE AT THE TIME OF PAYMENT".

TO AGREE TO THE H. R. AMENDMENT TO THE COMMERCIAL INTER- COURSE BILL, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT OF THE 11TH SEC- TION THAT PART WHICH WOULD GIVE AUTHORITY TO THE GOVERNMENT TO ISSUE UNDER SUITABLE PLEDGES AND PRECAUTIONS, LETTERS OF MARQUE AND REPRISAL AGAINST THE NATION THEREAFTER CONTINUING IN FORCE ITS UNLAWFUL EDICTS AGAINST THE COMMERCE OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AGREE TO THE H. R. AMENDMENT TO THE COMMERCIAL INTER- COURSE BILL, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT OF THE 12TH SEC- TION THE WORDS "FOURTH OF MARCH NEXT", AND INSERT "FIFTEENTH OF MARCH, 1809", THUS CHANGING THE DATE FOR REPEAL OF EM- BARGO ACTS.

TO AMEND THE H. R. BILL (2 STAT. 545, APP. 3/3/1809), TO AMEND THE SEVERAL ACTS FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT AND REGULATION OF THE TREASURY, WAR, AND NAVY DEPARTMENTS AND MAKING APPRO- PRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT AND THE NAVY FOR 1809, BY ELIMINATING NOT PART OF THE 6TH SEC- TION WHICH APPROPRIATES ONE MILLION DOLLARS, IN ADDITION TO THE SUMS HERETOFORE APPROPRIATED FOR THE FORTIFICATIONS OF PORTS AND HARBORS.
TO PASS THE HOUSE "ADDITIONAL DUTIES", BILL AS AMENDED.

TO INSIST ON SENATE AMENDMENTS TO THE H. R. BILL (2 STAT. 545, APP. 3/3/1809), TO AMEND THE SEVERAL ACTS FOR THE ES- TABLISHMENT AND REGULATION OF THE TREASURY, WAR, AND NAVY DEPARTMENTS, AND MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE MILITARY AND NAVAL ESTABLISHMENT FOR 1809.
